headline: Teledyne FLIR Defense Wins $15 Million Contract for Black Hornet 4 Nano-Drones
summary: OSLO, Norway, February 26, 2025--Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), has received an order from the German Army to provide its Black Hornet® 4 Personal Reconnaissance Systems to German armed forces.

content.title: Teledyne FLIR Defense Wins $15 Million Contract for Black Hornet 4 Nano-Drones
content.summary: OSLO, Norway, February 26, 2025--Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), has received an order from the German Army to provide its Black Hornet® 4 Personal Reconnaissance Systems to German armed forces.

thumbnail.caption: Teledyne FLIR Defense has received an order from the German Army to provide its Black Hornet® 4 nano-drone system to German armed forces. The $15 million contract was facilitated by Teledyne FLIR’s regional partner, European Logistic Partners (ELP) GmbH of Wuppertal, Germany. Black Hornet 4 represents the next generation of lightweight nano-drones, able to provide enhanced covert situational awareness to small fighting units. It delivers crisp thermal/visual imagery to operators. At just 70 grams, Black Hornet 4 can fly for over 30 minutes, more than two kilometers, and function in 25-knot winds and rain. (Photo: Business Wire)
